pullrequest.title: Use gzdev tool to install repositories

content.raw: Is it possible to have a brief overview of the `gzdev` project? I've looked at the README, but I haven't had a chance to look at all the code or pull requests you've been reviewing
content.html: Is it possible to have a brief overview of the gzdev project? I've looked at the README, but I haven't had a chance to look at all the code or pull requests you've been reviewing

pullrequest.title: Use gzdev tool to install repositories

content.raw: Yep. The Gazebo developers tool project aka `gzdev` is and idea to make some useful tasks for Gazebo users/developers easier. It's based on plugins each of them doing one particular task. The `master` branch hosts the `spawn`plugin \(an idea superseded by rocon months after\). The new module named used here `repository` \(in[ this pull request](https://github.com/osrf/gzdev/pulls)\) is designed to install Gazebo/ROS repositories in a Linux system providing a single point for configuration so we can change the repositories URLs or keys in a single step.  [This change to the readme file](https://github.com/osrf/gzdev/pull/6/files?short_path=04c6e90#diff-04c6e90faac2675aa89e2176d2eec7d8) has a little man page for it.
content.html: Yep. The Gazebo developers tool project aka gzdev is and idea to make some useful tasks for Gazebo users/developers easier. It's based on plugins each of them doing one particular task. The master branch hosts the spawnplugin (an idea superseded by rocon months after). The new module named used here repository (in this pull request) is designed to install Gazebo/ROS repositories in a Linux system providing a single point for configuration so we can change the repositories URLs or keys in a single step. This change to the readme file has a little man page for it.

content.raw: I’m going to modify this PR to make -debbuild- jobs to use the standard repo and not the testing one \(which can be dangerous for new releases\).
